pli-tv-bu-vb-sk29:2.1: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk29:5.1: 29. The training rule on receiving an even measure of bean curry
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk29:6.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk29:6.2: At that time the monks from the group of six were receiving large amounts of bean curry with their almsfood. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk29:8.2: there are two kinds of bean curry: mung-bean curry and black-gram curry, to be taken with the hand.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk29:8.3: Almsfood should be received with the right proportion of bean curry.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk29:8.4: If a monk out of disrespect receives much bean curry, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk29:9.6: if it is any food apart from bean curry;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk29:9.8: if it is from those who have given an invitation;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk29:9.9: if it is for the benefit of someone else;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk29:9.10: if it is by means of his own property;
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk29:9.13: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk29:10.1: The ninth training rule is finished.
